noun.description: Notice taken of someone or something; the regarding of someone or something as interesting or important.
examples: he drew attention to three spelling mistakes
you've never paid that much attention to her opinions

noun.description: The action of dealing with or taking special care of someone or something.
examples: he failed to give the patient adequate medical attention

noun.description: A position assumed by a soldier, standing very straight with the heels together and the arms straight down the sides of the body.
examples: the squadron stood to attention when we arrived

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin attentio(n-), from the verb attendere (see attend).
